DataElement.preferredName: Patient Intolerance Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions that prevent a person from being allowed to participate in a clinical study whose inability to absorb or metabolize certain substances in the normal way as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Intolerance Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._An inability to absorb or metabolize certain substances in the normal way._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Intolerance Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An inability to absorb or metabolize certain substances in the normal way.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: An inability to absorb or metabolize certain substances in the normal way.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient unable to tolerate
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient unable to tolerate BRAF inhibitor and/or MEK inhibitor therapy due to grade greater than or equal to 2 toxicity (CTCAE v5.0) from these agents, irrespective of antitumor response, are the following conditions met: (a) toxicities persisted despite change from doublet to singlet therapy (i.e. from concurrent BRAF inhibition plus MEK inhibition to BRAF inhibition alone), (b) toxicities are attributed to a class effect, and therefore switch from one drug to another is expected to induce the same type of toxicity (e.g. ocular toxicities or cardiac dysfunction from MEK inhibitor), (c) drug-specific toxicities that do not resolve with switch from one BRAF inhibitor to another (i.e. dabrafenib to vemurafenib, or vice versa)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient received prior cobimetinib, were they able to tolerate cobimetinib at the dose and schedule they would receive it on study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of inability to tolerate capecitabine at the projected treatment dose on this trial?
